comments.message:
I like to use MRT the most when i travel the cities in Singapore😊 I'm sure that MRT is the fastest transport during rush hour. No traffic jam, Very safe. And cooool air conditioner.😚I've studied in SG for almost one year, and i 've used many countries' subway systems. In my opinion, MRT has the easiest route to find my destination. I'd never lost my way in MRT..That's amazing!!👍  

 Meanwhile, i heard the news that the new MRT lines will be completed in the first quarter of next year! Then i will be able to reach Orchard from Bukit tima only for 20min!😆 That's really cool!:) Lastly, I'm glad to celebrate SG 50th anniversary while studying in SG😆 💕  #SG50 #CocaCola
I like it that our MRT system breakdown most of the time.

I saw few designs of SG50 theme coke tin at Giant and immediately fell in love with it because I am coke bottle collector, I am just simply like the art shown on the bottle, how creative and amazing it is! With MRT system showing on the bottle really make me feel gratitude and appreciate even more as it brings convenience to majority of the people here in SG.Thank you Coca Cola and thank you Singapore! Happy SG50! 😄😄 #SG50
I like the mrt train because I don't need to wait much time on peak period. Unlike last time, when peak period I need wait 2-3 mrt trains. And it always cause me to late for work or school..

I love the clean and bright trains, the speed during peak hours, and the network connects me to more places directly than before! #SG50

Thank you for the giveaway! Cheers!
SBS & SMRT did a good job in always ensuring us a pleasant and safe journey. We are so fortunate compared to many other countries.

Honestly, I like that we can get where we want to go, and fast,  thanks to the MRT. Yes, sometimes the systems breaks down, but we all have our bad days, so does the MRT 😂

We should feel fortunate that our country has such a convenient system of travel, one just needs to look at the trains in 3rd world countries to feel privileged. Count your blessings people, anybody can complain but it is the rare few that can appreciate. :)
that we can get from jurong to pasir ris within 90 minutes (notwithstanding any train or track breakdown though).

Thumbs up to MRT system! It was great transport and brings you to the places you want to. You'll enjoying the aircon while travelling and made you relax as well. Happy to experience the services while staying and working here in Singapore. HAPPY SG50!!!
I also like Coca Cola, I also got collect some unique n limited edition bottles.
I like our Mrt system! It's clean n spacious! Important it's will bring us to e place we going without jam and accidents, faster too!!! Alots easy way to many other places!
Is it the best idea to associate your brand with the mrt now?
Singapore MRT is butter to ride because their's no tropic jam.... And clean...or I'll's their's an Accident ... On the station.... Then get tropic Jam...
I like how we are so connected via our MRT system.
Saying good stuff just to win something?  Forget it! The mrt is in a big mess following the recent massive meltdown and what's scary is they still don't know what hit them and it could happen again!

I like how i can tell others that anywhere that is within walking distance from any mrt stations are considered near to me! And i like how i never have to be afraid of taking wrong bus or missed any bus stop. Because i only need to alight at the nearest mrt station! Mrt really connect us to anywhere and any time!
i used to be proud of our public transport system but all the recent outages just show us that essential public services should never be commercialize.
I like our transport system as it had been bringing everyone in Singapore the convenience to travel in fast and short distance and saves alot of time from 1 place to another .
I like how the recent spate of MRT breakdowns bring out the best in Singaporeans. We always shine in adversity.
Singapore MRT is super fast to reach our destination.

Mrt is my life saver, remember those times when I have to wake up veru early to travel by bus from east to west to study but when mrt is up it really save a lot of time, convenience, n hassle free. Even though at times now there are hiccups here n there its still the best transport system

I like it that our MRT system brings us closer together within an hour or so. It brings us closer to what's cool, what's happening and who are awesome :)

I live in the far western part of Singapore, but I am just glad I have two ways to go to Town - one quite-long way and another, not-quite-long-but-need-to-transfer-train way. They're all good! :)

If only the MRT system could be more reliable. It is not looking good right now, but changes are on the way.

Till then, Coke ads will just do to while away waiting time. We'll all open happiness after we board the train and share our joy watching fun Coke ads on the train, together, with those who matter to us. :D
I like our transport system because it's clean and spacious. Most importantly, it bring us to places without jam and road accidents!

I like the forever expanding MRT network, and the fact that I can travel to anywhere on time at just $120 max a month (as compared to taking cab / owning a car).

People fall sick once in a while, traffic accidents happen each day, and our trains break down at times. I didn't score 100 marks for all my exams, and neither am I a perfect person, so when MRT takes me to my destinations without fail 95% of the time, I'm contented and  thankful for that. :)
It's a great mode of transport which makes us realise that Singapore is not that big and all corners of our sunny island can be easily accessible by the wonderful train service. :-)

11.post_text:
4 things you need to know about personalising your #ShareaCokeSG can!

1) How?
Customise your can at our roadshows with every $10 purchase of Coca-Cola products in one single receipt.

2) Where?
Roadshow locations can be found on www.shareacoke.com.sg

3) Combine receipts?
Proof of Purchase from 7-Eleven and Cheers can be in 3 combined receipts. We appreciate your support for our participating retailers.

4) Characters?
Maximum 12 characters including spaces & hyphens. Special characters, offensive content and trademarked names are not allowed.

See you at our roadshows! #ShareHappiness

You won’t believe how easy it is to get your name on a Coca-Cola can! Visit our #ShareACokeSG  roadshows to get your own personalised can now! The upcoming roadshow are on:

12-14 June: 
Faber Peak Singapore (12 pm-8 pm)
Sentosa Beach Station (12 pm - 8 pm)
Fairprice Xtra NEX (12 pm - 9 pm)
Giant Tampines (12 pm 9 pm)

Details: http://www.coca-cola.com.sg/SHAREACOKESG/

23.post_text:
Congratulations Foo Mui Li! You are the week 5 winner of our #ShareaCokeSG personalised can giveaway. Kindly PM us your contact details so that we may get in touch with you :)

Want your own personalised can? We got you covered! All you have to do is use our Share a Coke app at apps.facebook.com/ShareACokeSG and send a virtual #Coke can to a friend to stand chance to win your own free personalised can!

Contest ends on 28th June, 2015. Terms and conditions apply.
